SXTgetdata

SXTgetdata.Rd

SXTgetdata is used to split data into tags, subject and QC.

SXTgetdata <- function(filename = "Metabolomics data", polarity = "none",
                          minfrac.qc = 0.8, minfrac.sample = 0.5, filter = "no",
                          normalization.method = "svr",
                          optimization = TRUE, begin = 0.5, end = 1,step = 0.2,
                          ##loess parameters
                          multiple = 5,
                          ##svr parameters
                          rerun.loess = TRUE, rerun.svr = TRUE,
                          peakplot=TRUE, datastyle = "tof", dimension1 = TRUE, user="other")

Details

Package:SXTgetdata
Type:Package
Version:1.1
Date:2016-04-27
License:Nothing
Depends:R (> = 3.1.1)
Imports:e1071
Version 1.1:(1) The data after normalization can be given dimension. See the Argument: dimensition1. (2) The injection order can be got from a new file named as "worklist.csv". See the example. (3) It can process positive and negative data together. See the Argument: polarity.

Value

peak plot:A folder contains all the peaks plot before and sfter SVR normalization.
data svr nor.csv:A csv data after SVR normalization
normalization file:The intermediate data
RSD compare plot.jpeg:A figure show the comparing of RSDs of peaks before and after SVR normalization
RSD distribution.csv:RSD distributions of data before and after SVR normalization
RSD distribution.jpeg:A figure show the RSD distributions before and after SVR normalization
rsd.change.csv:A table show the RSDs of peaks before and after SVR normalization

References

Normalization and Integration of Large-Scale Metabolomics Data Using Support Vector Regression
